TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XhtmlMobileTextWriter extends System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Provides text writer functionality for devices targeted by the XHTML adapter set, including Extensible Hypertext Markup Language (XHTML), XHTML Mobile, and Wireless Markup Language (WML). For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks XHTML is an XML-compliant markup that is based on HTML 4.1 and allows you to create Web sites suitable for multiple device types. It merges HTML's ease of use with XML's strict element guidelines to produce a markup language with a wide range of format and style options and reduced markup tag ambiguity. This class provides formatting capabilities that ASP.NET server controls use when rendering XHTML content to clients. The XhtmlMobileTextWriter renders markup that meets the standards of three different XHTML doc types: XHTML Basic, which supports limited style and format elements; XHTML Mobile Profile, which supports inline style sheets; and WML 2.0, which is based on XHTML 1.1 and supports cascading style sheets.
This class is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The XhtmlMobileTextWriter class can render all HTML elements, attributes, and style attributes, but, unlike the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class, does not allow title capitalization of these markup elements.
An <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter> instantiates an XhtmlMobileTextWriter and depending on the capabilities of the target device, initializes a number of properties, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SupportsNoWrapStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.UseDivsForBreaks%2A>, that assist the text writer in rendering the page and its controls.
Your adapter can use a variety of methods to apply styles and control formatting:
- <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A>,
- <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.EnterLayout%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.ExitLayout%2A>, and
- <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.EnterFormat%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.ExitFormat%2A>.
> [!NOTE] > This class derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter> class, which in turn derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MultiPartWriter> class, and much of its functionality is provided by these base classes.
You can use the members of this class, and any members it inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter> class, to create custom text writers to use in a custom XHTML page or in class adapters. You can also create new derived classes that override the standard behavior of the XhtmlMobileTextWriter class.
Device filtering is required in order to use a specific adapter or text writer for a server control. For more information about device filtering, see [Architectural Overview of Adaptive Control Behavior](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [Device Filtering Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

Docs.param: The base writer object, usually an object.
An object of class that provides the capability information for the target device.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the provided device, using the parameter as the base writer object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Text writers are instantiated by a corresponding page adapter for a specific target device, and then used by the page adapter and the adapters for each control on the page.
This class is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void AddOnEnterForwardSetVar (string var);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddOnEnterForwardSetVar(string var) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of a variable to be embedded in a page.
Docs.summary: Adds a provided variable name to a list of variables to be embedded in pages for WML devices. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Certain WML devices require a `<wml:onevent>` element to provide information for postback.
WML devices provide limited functionality for navigation and postback, and require WML commands and variables to be written to the page.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
## Examples When rendering the page, the following `<wml:onevent>` structure might be included in the page's markup:
`<wml:onevent type="onenterforward">`
`<wml:refresh>`
`<wmlsetvar name="buttonSaveClicked" />`
`<wmlsetvar name="nextPage" value="3" />`
`</wml:refresh>`
`</wml:onevent>`
Depending on the user's actions, the values might be modified by scripts on the page to return the following structure on postback:
`<wml:onevent type="onenterforward">`
`<wml:refresh>`
`<wmlsetvar name="buttonSaveClicked" value="true" />`
`<wmlsetvar name="nextPage" value="9" />`
`</wml:refresh>`
`</wml:onevent>`

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void AddOnEnterForwardSetVar (string var, string value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddOnEnterForwardSetVar(string var, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the variable.
The value for the variable.
Docs.summary: Adds a provided variable name and value to a list of variables to be embedded in pages for WML devices. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Certain WML 2.0 devices require a WML `<wml:onevent>` element to provide information for postback.
WML devices provide limited functionality for navigation and postback, and require WML commands and variables to be written to the page.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
## Examples When rendering the page, the following `<wml:onevent>` structure might be included in the page's markup:
`<wml:onevent type="onenterforward">`
`<wml:refresh>`
`<wmlsetvar name="buttonSaveClicked" />`
`<wmlsetvar name="nextPage" value="3" />`
`</wml:refresh>`
`</wml:onevent>`
Depending on the user's actions, the values might be modified by scripts on the page to return the following structure on postback:
`<wml:onevent type="onenterforward">`
`<wml:refresh>`
`<wmlsetvar name="buttonSaveClicked" value="true" />`
`<wmlsetvar name="nextPage" value="9" />`
`</wml:refresh>`
`</wml:onevent>`

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string CacheKey { get; }
.property instance string CacheKey

Docs.summary: Gets the unique key used to retrieve items from the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Cache%2A>. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Some devices do not allow inline styles in elements, but require style information to be provided from a linked style sheet. If the linked style sheet is stored in the <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache>, the URL contains a unique CacheKey that identifies the style sheet to return. For these target devices, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter> moves style information from rendered controls to a style sheet for caching.
A page adapter can instruct the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter> to save the style sheet in the <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache> using <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SetCacheKey%2A>, or in the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Session%2A> using <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SetSessionKey%2A> before rendering the page.
This property is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SetCacheKey%2A> method has not been called.

This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Some devices do not allow inline styles in elements, but require style information to be provided from a linked style sheet. If the linked style sheet is stored in the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Session%2A>, the URL contains a unique SessionKey that identifies the style sheet to return. For these target devices, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter> moves style information from rendered controls to a style sheet for caching in the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Session%2A>.
A page adapter can instruct the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter> to save the style sheet in the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Session%2A> using <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SetSessionKey%2A>, or in the <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache> using <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SetCacheKey%2A> before rendering the page.
This property is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SetSessionKey%2A> method has not been called.

This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If there is a pending break, is `false`, and the provided tag is not a block element (such as `

`, `

`, `
    `, or ``), which automatically break before and after the element, the method is called before writing the beginning tag. This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteDoctypeDeclaration(valuetype System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.Doctype type) cil managed

Docs.param: A value indicating the type of declaration to write.
Docs.summary: Writes a declaration that is unique to target devices represented by the provided value. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The page adapter calls this method, and depending on the `type`, writes the following document type declarations:
|Type|Description| |----------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.Doctype>|\<\!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML Basic 1.0//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-basic/xhtml-basic10.dtd">| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.Doctype>|\<\!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//WAPFORUM//DTD XHTML Mobile 1.0//EN" "http://www.wapforum.org/DTD/xhtml-mobile10.dtd">| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.Doctype>|\<\!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//WAPFORUM//DTD WML 2.0//EN" "http://www.wapforum.org/dtd/wml20.dtd">|
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the tag is not a block element, such as `

`, `

`, ``, `
    `, the method is called before writing the beginning tag. This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteHiddenField(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the hidden field.
Docs.summary: Writes the markup for a hidden field to the output stream using the provided name. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WriteHiddenField method is useful for pages where client-side code will add and modify the value of this field for postback, because no initial value is provided.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WritePendingBreak() cil managed

Docs.summary: Writes a line terminator string to the output stream if the current element is not a block element such as , , , , and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine%2A> is , and there is a pending break. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void WriteUrlParameter (string name, string value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteUrlParameter(string name, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: A string containing the name of the URL parameter.
A string containing the value of the URL parameter.
Docs.summary: Writes an encoded URL, which includes a query-string parameter, to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Both the name of the parameter and the URL value are encoded, and an equal sign (=) is inserted between them. Spaces in the `name` or `value` strings are encoded as plus signs (+), and equal signs (=) are encoded as %3d.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void WriteXmlDeclaration ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteXmlDeclaration() cil managed

Docs.summary: Writes an XML declaration along with the current document encoding value. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the current encoding is UTF-8, the declaration output would be:
`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>`
